keyPolicies.policyDescription: Delivered an £800 income tax cut for 58,100 working people.
Created 1,790 new apprenticeship places in Ealing and Acton to help more young people start great work.
Protected the NHS budget and invested an extra £2 billion for frontline NHS services, with a commitment to increasing this figure a year by 2020.

issues.governance: Worked towards a fairer society, introduced the £800 income tax cut instead of tax cuts for millionaires, allowed schools to run for profit, and gave employees protection against being fired without a reason.
issues.health: Protected the NHS budget by investing an extra £2 billion for frontline services.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm proud that in the last five years the Liberal Democrats have worked towards doing just that. Here in Ealing and Acton they have...

images.caption: Photographs of Jon Ball with various individuals presumably involved in the campaign.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Calls out the Labour party for growing the government without effective results and criticizes the Tories potentially not implementing the £800 income tax cut and allowing for unfair employer practices.
